trans-unit.source: Represents a virtual container service associated with an editing context and design view.
The virtual container service is used to customize the UI virtualization behavior.
UI virtualization is used to render only the areas of the designer canvas that are currently in view, making the designer more responsive and less memory consuming.

By default, both procedural and flowchart designers are virtualization aware, but if you were to construct a control flow designer that would be larger than an individual screen, that designer could benefit from virtualization.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.VirtualizedContainerService"></xref> class with a specific editing context.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref> for the service.
Gets a container and associates it with a specified model item and returns a UI element that represents the association.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> associated with the container.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.ICompositeView"></xref> that is associated with the model item.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that represents the container associated with the model item.
Attempts to get a value for the Hint Size Name property.
<xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.VirtualizedContainerService.GetHintSize%2A> does not throw an exception if the property is not found in the store.
The property store.
The destination <xref href="System.Object"></xref> for the value.
Returns the workflow view element that corresponds to the specified model item.
The underlying model item of the workflow view element to get.
The drag source dependency property value to set for the workflow view element.
The workflow view element that corresponds to the specified model item.
Provides a XAML type system identifier.
The identifier is a string that consists of the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.VirtualizedContainerService> type plus "HintSize".
Attempts to set a value for the Hint Size Name property.
This method parses the assigned `value` into a <xref:System.Windows.Size> object; therefore the string must be formatted using en-us culture.
The property store.
The value set.
